intro: Bartsia crisafullii subsp. acutiloba, commonly known as the acute-lobed bartsia, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of southern Europe. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae, which includes many parasitic and hemiparasitic species. The plant is characterized by its delicate, herbaceous stems and small, lance-shaped leaves. It produces clusters of white or pale yellow flowers during the spring and summer months. This subspecies is notable for its ecological role in supporting pollinators and its adaptation to high-altitude environments.
